arts.ttl: FPL notes: Cunha injury latest, Haaland ends drought + Savinho impresses
arts.sum: Our Gameweek 19 Scout Notes begin with Spurs v Wolves and Leicester v Man City The post FPL notes: Cunha injury latest, Haaland ends drought + Savinho impresses appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: Papers: Arsenal and Man City set to battle to sign Zubimendi in January
arts.sum: The top stories and transfer rumours from Monday's newspapers...

arts.ttl: Leicester City look to ex-Newcastle United man in bid to for Premier League survival
arts.sum: Leicester City have reportedly identified a former Newcastle United defender ahead of the January transfer window as they look to retain their Premier League status beyond this season. Mbemba was a member of the Magpies side that secured promotion back to the Premier League at the first time of asking back in 2017 before helping them maintain their place in England's top tier the season after.

arts.ttl: Man City top scorers of 2024 as Erling Haaland leads the way but unexpected name finished 3rd
Guardiola says Man City has 'no chance' of winning Premier League despite win in 500th game
arts.sum: Even after marking his 500th game in charge of Manchester City with a much-needed victory, Pep Guardiola insisted his team has “no chance” of winning a fifth straight Premier League title. So after winning an unprecedented four straight Premier League titles, Guardiola has already written off his team’s chances before reaching January.

arts.ttl: Pep on reaching 500 matches at Man City
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola said he could cry with pride and that there is "more to come" from his Manchester City team after he reached 500 matches in all competitions as manager of the club with a 2-0 win at Leicester City. If you create a Premier League table starting when Guardiola joined Man City, his team would rank first with a whopping 45 points more than any other team.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola delivers surprising Leicester City assessment after Man City beat Foxes
arts.sum: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has declared that Leicester City were the better team in the second half of his side's 2-0 victory over the Foxes on Sunday. "The performance was not our best, Leicester were good," Man City's boss told BBC Match of the Day after the game.

arts.ttl: Erling Haaland becomes a dad for the first time after partner Isabel Haugseng Johansen gives birth - as Pep Guardiola accidentally reveals the big news!
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola accidentally revealed that Erling Haaland has become a first-time father in the past few days. The Man City manager let the news slip after his side's 2-0 victory at Leicester on Sunday.

arts.ttl: Honest Pep Guardiola reflects on Man City mistakes - and makes telling point
arts.sum: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola reflected on the difficulties that the team have gone through in recent months

arts.ttl: Relief for Pep Guardiola as Manchester City stop rot with win at Leicester
arts.athr: Ben Fisher at the King Power Stadium
arts.sum: Savinho and Haaland on target in champions’ 2-0 victory ‘We will improve as the results improve, that’s for sure’ Pep Guardiola said Manchester City’s return to winning ways will “clear our minds and souls”, and he insisted the Premier League champions will get back to their best after a welcome victory at Leicester. Guardiola expressed his relief after City halted their miserable run of results by recording their first win in six matches and only their second in 14 in all competitions. Continue reading...
